member.name: T:VDS.RDF.Storage.AdoSchemaHelper
member.summary: Static Helper class which managers the available database schemas

remarks.para: The ADO Store was specifically designed to be completely based upon use of stored procedures so any schema can potentially be used provided it exposed the stored procedures that the code expects to exist.

There are two schemas provided by default, the Hash schema is recommended but requires SQL Server 2005 or higher. The Simple schema is less performant but has a version that works with earlier versions of SQL Server e.g. SQL Server 2000. We strongly recommend the Hash schema for all new development!

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.AdoSchemaHelper.AddSchema(VDS.RDF.Storage.AdoSchemaDefinition)
member.summary: Adds a new Schema Definition

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.AdoSchemaHelper.RemoveSchema(VDS.RDF.Storage.AdoSchemaDefinition)
member.summary: Removes a Schema Definition

member.name: P:VDS.RDF.Storage.AdoSchemaHelper.SchemaDefinitions
member.summary: Gets the available built-in schemas

member.name: P:VDS.RDF.Storage.AdoSchemaHelper.DefaultSchema
member.summary: Gets/Sets the Default Schema

member.name: T:VDS.RDF.Storage.AzureAdoManager
member.summary: An implementation of an ADO Store Manager for use with SQL Azure
member.remarks: Essentially just derived from the more general MicrosoftAdoManager with a constructor which reduces the amount of input you need to create an instance that will connect to SQL Azure successfully

member.name: T:VDS.RDF.Storage.MicrosoftAdoManager
member.summary: Implementation of the ADO Store against Microsoft SQL Server

remarks.para: This code cannot communicate with legacy SQL Stores and this is by design, please see this page for details on migrating legacy stores

member.name: T:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoSqlClientStore
member.summary: Abstract Base implementation of the ADO Store for stores that are accessed using the System.Data.SqlClient API

member.name: T:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5
member.summary: Abstract Base implementation of the ADO Store

remarks.para: The ADO Store is a complete redesign of our SQL backed storage that does everything via stored procedures which provides a much better level of abstraction between the code and the SQL database schema. This allows the database schemas to be flexible and take adavantage of the features of different SQL backends, we ship with three default ADO Schemas, use the AdoSchemaHelper class to get information about these.
This code cannot communicate with legacy SQL Stores and this is by design, please see this page for details on migrating legacy stores

member.summary: Creates a new ADO Store

member.summary: Finalizer for the ADO Store Manager which ensures that it is disposed of properly

member.remarks: Assumes that the resource is embedded in this assembly

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5.ExecuteSqlFromResource(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Executes the SQL from an embedded resource

remarks.para: Heavily adapted from code used in BugNet

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5.ExecuteSql(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Executes the SQL from a stream

remarks.para: Heavily adapted from code used in BugNet

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5.ReadNextStatementFromStream(System.IO.StreamReader)
member.summary: Reads the next statement from stream.

remarks.para: Taken from code used in BugNet

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5.CheckVersion
member.summary: Checks the Version of the Store

remarks.para:
This is intended for two purposes:
Future proofing so later versions of the library can add additional stored procedures to the database and the code can decide which are available to it
Detecting when users try to use the class to connect to legacy databases created with the old Schema which are not compatible with this code

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5.CheckSchema
member.summary: Checks the Schema of the Store

remarks.para: As the ADO Store is designed entirely in terms of stored procedures the underlying database schema is up to the implementor, two different schemas are provided in the library by default.
This method should report the name of the schema, this may refer to one of the inbuilt schemas or may refer to a custom implemented schema.

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5.ClearStore
member.summary: Clears the Store

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5.ClearStore(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clears the Store
member.param: Whether to perform a full clear

remarks.para: A Full Clear will remove all existing Node Value to ID mappings whereas a normal clear leaves those in place. If the data you intend to insert into the store after clearing it is similar to the data in the store currently then you should not perform a full clear as leaving the Node Value to ID mappings will make future imports faster.

member.name: M:VDS.RDF.Storage.BaseAdoStore`5.GetID(VDS.RDF.INode)
member.summary: Gets the Node ID for a value (if such a value exists in the store)
member.returns: Either a Node ID or zero if the value does not exist in the store

remarks.para: This overload does not create Node IDs if the value does not exist, if you need to create a value use the overload which allows you to specify whether to create new Node IDs as needed

para.strong: Cannot be used to get IDs for Blank Nodes
